text:
William E. Munger, Ph. D.

 

CURRICULUM VITAE «

Department of Pathology
University of Connecticut Health Center
Farmington, CT 06032

Telephone Number: 203-674-2195

AL

 

GENERAL INFORMATION

1, Born March 16, 1953, Whittier, CA

2. Married

3. Social Security No. 552-88-1143

EDUCATION

1, B.A., University of California, Santa Barbara, 1975.

2. Ph.D., University of Connecticut, 1982.

APPOINTMENTS

1. Post-doctoral Fellow, Department of Pathology, University of

Connecticut Health Center, Farmington, CT, 1981-present.

PUBLICATIONS

1. Munger, W. E. and Lindquist, R. R. The effect of phorbol esters
on alloimmune cytolysis. Cancer Res. 42:5023-5029, 1982,

2. Munger, W. E. and Lindquist, R. R. 12-0-tetradecanoy phorbol-12-
acetate (ITPA) augments the killing ability of a Lyt 1-negative,
Tow Lyt-2-expressing subpopulation of alloimmne killers. In
preparation.

3. p'Silva, H., Munger, W., Cohen, M. C. and Cohen, S. Effect of
lymphokines on intraperitoneal neoplasms. In preparation.

4. Mecley, M., Munger, W., Picciano, P. and Cohen, M. C. Interactions
between neoplastic ceils and endothelial in vitro. ‘In preparation.

5. Munger, W. E. and Lindquist, R. R. Augmentation of alToinmune
cytolysis by the phorbol ester, TPA. Fed. Proc. 39(3):924, 1980
(abst).

6. Munger, W. E, and Lindquist, R. R. 12-0-tetradecanoy Iphorbol-13-
acetate (TPA) augments ailoimmune cell-mediated cytotoxicity (CMC).
Amer. Assoc. for Cancer Res. 21:227, 1980 (abst).

7. Munger, W. E. and Lindquist, R. R. 12-0-tetradecanoy phorbol -13-

acetate activates a low Lyt 2 antigen expressing, poorly cytolytic
teams T killer subpopulation. Fed. Proc. 41(3):415, 1982
abst).

 

50234969

summary: William E. Munger, Ph. D. is a professor of Pathology at the University of Connecticut. He is the author of a book on the effects of the phorbol ester, TPA, on alloimmune cytolysis. The book is entitled, ‘The Effects of The Phorbols on Allo immune Cytotoxicity.’
